TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_E_11_a
TestCase.Purpose: This test case checks the behavior of the eID-Client in case the host name of the eID-Server does not match with the server identity contained eID-Server certificate. The SubjectAltName of type dNSName in the host certificate does not match with the eID-Server's host name.
TestCase.Precondition: A single basic card reader is connected to the eID-Client system.
A single active eID-Card is connected to the card reader.

TestStep.Description: [TC_TOKEN_URL] is a valid https-URL where the TC Token can be retrieved by the eID-Client.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client is activated and starts establishment of channel TLS-1-2 to the TC Token Provider.

Command.Text: The TC Token Provider accepts the connection TLS-1-2.

TestStep.Description: The TC Token Provider uses TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_3_A] from [CERT_SET_3].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client submits a HTTP GET to [TC_TOKEN_URL] via the channel TLS-1-2.

Command.Text: Check if the eID-Client requests the TC Token via the provided URL and respond to the eID-Client with a valid TC Token.

TestStep.Description: The HTTP response containing TC Token has "Content-Type: text/xml" and "charset=utf-8". The response does not contain any further content besides TC Token.
TC Token contains the default parameters.
Parameter "PSK" is randomly set to value [PSK].
Parameter "SessionIdentifier" is randomly set to value [SID].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client starts establishment of channel TLS-2 to the eID-Server.

Command.Text: The eID-Server accepts the connection TLS-2.

TestStep.Description: The eID-Server offers a TLS_RSA_PSK_* cipher suite listed for TLS-2 in the ICS of the eID-Client.
The eID-Server uses the TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_EIDSERVER_3_A] from [CERT_SET_3]
The server identity contained in the SubjectAltName of type dNSName of the server certificate does not match with [SERVERADRESS_NNM].

ExpectedResult.Text: The TLS-2 channel is not established.
The connection establishment is aborted by the eID-Client.
The eID-Client directs the browser to the "RefreshAddress".
In case of a web server based Client-Interface, the eID-Client uses "303 See Other" for the redirection.
The redirection includes an additional URL-Parameter "ResultMajor=error&ResultMinor=res_min", where res_min is "trustedChannelEstablishmentFailed" or "clientError".
